channel.title: INtech
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtech, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Want to know where VCs are investing next? Be in the room at TechCrunch Disrupt 2025
item.description: Early-stage founders, listen up! You will want a front row seat at the Builders Stage on Oct 27 at 1:00 pm. This session at TechCrunch Disrupt 2025 br...

item.title: Recycled Polyester Saved This American Factory. Environmentalists Hate It
item.description: Unifi survived competition from China by helping fashion brands meet sustainability goals. But not everyone agrees that its polyester made from recycl...

item.title: TikTok parent ByteDance is shutting down its short-lived book publisher
item.description: The TikTok parent company ByteDance started a book publisher in 2023, but it's already shutting it down.

item.title: The Largest Camera Ever Built Releases Its First Images of the Cosmos

item.title: US insurance giant Aflac says customers’ personal data stolen during cyberattack
item.description: The U.S. insurance giant provides supplemental insurance to around 50 million customers.

item.title: Senators urge FTC to investigate Spotify’s higher-priced bundled subscription
item.description: Two U.S. senators have requested that the FTC investigate Spotify due to allegations that the company bundled its subscription without user consent, w...

item.title: Taiwan Is Rushing to Make Its Own Drones Before It's Too Late
item.description: Unmanned vehicles are increasingly becoming essential weapons of war. But with a potential conflict with China looming large, Taiwan is scrambling to ...

item.title: Japanese shipping firm NYK acquires Kadmos, a salary payment platform for seafarers
item.description: Japanese shipping company Nippon Yusen Kabushiki Kaisha is acquiring German salary payment platform for seafaring workers, Kadmos.

item.title: India Is Using AI and Satellites to Map Urban Heat Vulnerability Down to the Building Level
item.description: Remote-sensing data and artificial intelligence are mapping the most heat-vulnerable buildings in cities like Delhi, in an effort to target relief fro...

item.title: China's Electric Vehicle Factories Have Become Tourist Hotspots
item.description: Thousands of people are signing up to see the highly automated assembly lines of Chinese EV brands like Xiaomi and Nio.
